tsutaeyou
Dawn comes softer than a sleeping breath
Your dream runs through the forest now
You wake up and stir to find the light
If you have lost it, I will find it for you
It is hidden in our future
Now if we joined hands
we would go far away without letting go
In the memory of a far off day
the story of the blue country bloomed
Shining eyes
Your singing voice
Let us share it
Wolf and Careless Negotiations
I am sorry!
I should not have left you alone till dawn.
But it was fun for me as a trader!
Though I know you would not accept that...
It is narrow here.
Too narrow!
Well I will not deny that it is inconvenient,
but I like this kind of messy place.
Why is that?
It has a certain weight to it from the years it is been through.
Like how a tool slowly changes shape over time,
after being used for a long time it becomes unrivaled.
Like how the shape of a river changes with time?
Unfortunately, I do not really understand your analogy.
Then how about a person's heart?
You call it soul or something, right?
Soul, huh?
If you could pull it out and look at it, that might be a good analogy.
Slowly being chipped away at, injured, and repaired,
to the point where one could look at it and say, This is mine.
Whoop!
Please give me your hand, princess.
Very well.
If your soul could be pulled out and looked at...
I bet it would be dyed in my color.
I think it would be more appropriate to say poisoned.
If you say that,
I must be a deadly poison.
You have completely fallen for this smile, after all.
Then what color is your soul?
What color?
Various colors, I guess.
You can sense a selfish, possessive desire from me, right?
That is good,
I am the same after all.
Right.
Here we see a fork in the road.
How do you deal with such a selfish possessive desire?
Even for such difficult problems I could never solve...
It is not rare for there to be others who easily understand them.
Could it be that you are suffering from jealousy that arises from such possessive desires?
And so you are seeking a means to deal with it?
What if I said yes?
Thinking about it from your perspective,
I can come up with the best answer immediately.
The answer is that such feelings are impossible to deal with.
But self-hatred will follow.
So, right, you said?
Yes.
But...
Possessiveness and self-hatred...
I see.
I expect you just tried to step into my shoes and figure out my inner desires,
but in reality,
you just thought up how you want me to be.
Males really are idiotic creatures.
You are attracted by females being jealous,
acting all distressed and meek while wanting you and hating themselves, right?
And you want them to cling to the hand you kindly offer them.
Come now, let us go.
O-Okay.
So...
I am asking just to tease you, but...
Do you want to know how many I have had?
I just realized again just how delicate my heart is.
Now then...
I heard he is a difficult person, so let us do this carefully.
The pleasant, whimsical banter with you ends,
and I guess I am back to boring reality.
How about going back to the inn to sleep?
That would not be so bad.
Of course,
it would not be sheep I would be counting on top of the bed.
So?
How many?
It seems I really am a fool, even amongst men.
Who might you be?
I was introduced by Abe Boland.
He is been expecting you.
Please come in.
Sorry to have kept you waiting.
Well that is certainly a pleasing reaction to see.
Is not that great, Rigolo?
It is amazing, right?
If you put all your effort into it, it is possible to keep them green all year.
I see...
I heard about you from Fruhl.
She said there was someone with a strange request for me.
Ah, nice to meet you.
It is Lawrence.
Ah, I mean...
Craft Lawrence.
My name is Rigolo Deidre.
Nice to meet you.
And this is my traveling companion
Horo.
How delightful!
Nice to meet you.
Indeed.
Now then,
I am quite happy that you were awed by my prized garden.
What can I give you in thanks?
I expect you heard from Abe Boland,
but I was hoping you could show me the records regarding old legends and such in this town.
Oh?
So that really was what you came for.
Fruhl...
No, Abe.
Even though she puts on such a hard face, she is too playful.
So that is why you are not a long-bearded, frowning, difficult person?
She is saying all sorts of things about me again?
But I guess it is not a complete lie that I am a difficult person.
After all, recently I have been refusing meetings with people as much as possible.
I am also a merchant from outside the city.
Is it really okay for us to be talking?
Yes, you came at a good time.
This could be what they call god's guidance.
The meeting was still going on not long ago,
but it finally wrapped up and ended.
Oh?
As one might expect of a merchant who was introduced by that stubborn girl.
You do not let your guard down.
Always using one's utmost wit and cunning can become quite confusing.
The back of the back is the front.
Just now, you thought to yourself, Ah, the meeting ended early.
right?
I am the scribe for the Fifty-man meeting, after all.
I can understand the changing expressions of many people at once.
Even if I cannot understand just by your expressions, Lawrence.
The truth starts to show when combined with the movements of your companion.
Very impressive.
Not at all,
it is just an act of mine.
If I had ill intentions, I would not reveal what I knew.
And even if I could understand what someone really thinks,
I am no good at communicating what I want.
That makes me a failure as a merchant, right?
Unfortunately.
Thanks to that, I am not too popular with the ladies.
All the old books are in the basement.
Seems the back of the back is the front.
To think he was looking at my face too.
That is the first time I have seen such a trick.
Well, I think it is true he has no ill intentions.
He is like a child.
But with someone with such a skill by your side,
you could probably lead a very relaxed, worry-free life.
You are always brimming with ill intentions, are not you.
By the way,
I cannot hold back my curiosity, so if you do not mind my asking,
why do you want to know the legends of hundreds of years ago?
She is searching for her own origins.
Her origins?
Due to various circumstances, I am guiding her on her way home.
That is why.
I see.
So you are going north.
Yes.
We do not know the exact location yet.
We are at the stage where we are trying to find it using a legend she remembers.
Really?
No, I am sure you have your reasons.
The world is like that.
Sometimes children that come down from the north stay in this city.
There is nothing better than returning safely to one's homeland.
This is everything, so I thought it might be best if you take them all at once.
If you drop those, it will be three days without food.
I will take a few.
This is where I would like to ask you to read them here.
But I trust Fruhl, so if she trusts you I will trust you too.
However, others may not think that way.
Of course, I will be careful.
It must be really easy to wave your hands like that when you are not holding anything.
You should watch your mouth does not get you jilted one day.
Males just get overexcited when flattered.
Even though I am in no position to, I just get frustrated.
Geez.
Even being gluttonous has its limits, you know.
Nice evening.
I said it is a nice evening.
Though, if we had nothing but nights like this,
I might go bad.
Sweet and salty water, huh.
Sweet and salty water.
Oh?
The master will glare at you if you go out to other inns.
It is just for one day.
Of course, it would be a problem if we went every night.
Do you drink much?
It is exactly as you see.
I was talking with a fur trader from the north.
As I thought, there is little snow this year, so heading up there is convenient.
Thank you for going out of your way to find out.
If you want to know more details, that man...
Korka Coose.
Was that his name?
It does not really matter.
He is staying on the fourth floor.
He mentioned that he is normally free during evenings.
If you want more info, go ask him.
Thanks for the time being, then.
So sloppy.
Scary.
What do you mean?
It is scary.
Is there anything that scares you?
Everything's going well at the moment, is not it?
We are not caught up in any difficulties.
And the road north this year seems straightforward.
And so far,
we have not gotten into any fights.
What I am afraid of...
What I am afraid of is this.
You do not get it?
The end of our journey?
Of course, that is also scary.
But...
There is something more scary than that.
It is fine if you do not understand.
Actually,
if you come to realize what it is, I might be a bit troubled.
I do not mind if you go downstairs,
but only to the point where I do not get jealous.
It seems I like possessive girls who hate themselves.
Did a witch sneeze or something?
Did time stop?
Completely.
It is because I am a merchant but the old man is not.
There is nothing to talk about.
Thanks to you, I met with Rigolo without issue.
That guy has such a gloomy face, right?
I know, eh?
It is depressing being around someone so dreary.
I am envious of that special skill of his.
Is that so.
Rigolo took a liking to you, huh?
If you were to partner with him, most other merchants would be defenseless against you, do not you think?
Unfortunately he did not seem to have that intention.
His joy in life...
is taking repose in that dilapidated mansion.
You saw the garden, right?
It was magnificent.
It is very rare to see glass windows that big.
I cannot stand them.
I would go crazy.
So?
It seems they came to a conclusion at the meeting.
And what was it?
Unfortunately I did not get to hear.
Did you manage to get that out of him?
Me?
That guy is wary around me.
But yeah, if we could hear whether it is true or not from his own mouth...
Surprisingly it may be true.
But, what interests me is...
what your objective is in pursuing this conversation.
Straight to the point, huh.
Did not you come here for small business deals?
Or some trivial bargaining?
I am the same as the others.
Looking for some way to make a large profit from this.
What else is there besides that?
Avoiding a huge loss?
People have two eyes, but it is hard to watch out for both at the same time.
You are right in that avoiding a huge loss is a part of it.
Meaning?
I am trading in stone statues.
Of the Holy Mother?
You saw one?
I am just dragging stones, so the profit margins are not great.
But the moment the church offers its prayers to them, I can sell them at a high price.
Thanks to the Northern Expedition each year, there are a ridiculous number of people who buy them up.
We should be thankful for religion.
Unfortunately I do not pocket the profit from the blessing, but I make up for it in quantity.
But this year I was suddenly cut off!
I know well now that no one is faster than the Church to turn their back on a friend.
Recently the authority of the church in the south has been degrading.
I thought it was about time I stop leaving my load on a sinking ship.
So I thought to make a profit in the end and move elsewhere.
I see.
So, while I am at it, I figured if I can make a big profit off this, I will go south.
Maybe it is time I go on a pilgrimage.
On that note,
would you lend me some money?
I will get right to it as well.
Will you sell your companion?
